chatgpt_double_star.new_statement: Government should set a universal floor of essential coverage—primary, preventive, emergency, and mental-health care—so everyone can access needed treatment without medical bankruptcy, while leaving room for regulated private plans and supplemental options. Its role is to set fair rules and fund gaps: protect people with pre-existing conditions, negotiate and publish prices, reduce administrative waste, and reward outcomes over volume. Delivery should rely on a mix of public programs and competing private/community providers, with portable coverage, local flexibility, and clear accountability to keep costs sustainable and quality high.

chatgpt_double_star_rankings.new_statement: Government should guarantee a dependable baseline of affordable, high-quality healthcare—covering preventive, emergency, and mental-health care and protecting people with pre-existing conditions—so no one is driven into medical bankruptcy. This safety net should preserve patient choice and room for private innovation, delivered through accountable public programs and regulated private options that emphasize price transparency, streamlined administration, and evidence-based cost controls. Coverage should be portable for a mobile workforce and strengthened through partnerships with local providers, employers, and community organizations to improve access and outcomes while remaining fiscally sustainable.

chatgpt_double_star_personas.new_statement: Government should ensure that every person has access to a dependable baseline of affordable essential care—preventive, primary, emergency, mental health, and protection for pre-existing conditions—so no family or small business is driven into financial ruin by illness. That guarantee should be delivered in a fiscally responsible, transparent way that reduces waste, simplifies administration, and makes prices and outcomes easy to compare. People should be able to keep private coverage and choose their doctors when possible, while public programs partner with local providers, employers, and community organizations to fill gaps, improve rural access, and keep coverage portable across jobs.
